name: Irileth
role: Housecarl to Jarl Balgruuf; Commander of Whiterun's Elite Guard

aspects.high_concept: Dunmer Blade Between the Jarl and Everything That Wants Him Dead
aspects.trouble: Outsider in a City That Calls Itself Open
other_aspects: I Have Survived Things That Should Have Killed Me
Balgruuf's Life Comes Before My Own
Cold Certainty in the Face of Chaos
Dark Elf in a Nord World - Still Here

stunts: Housecarl's Oath: Irileth cannot be compelled to abandon Balgruuf while he lives; +2 to all actions taken in his direct defense.
Veteran's Read: Once per scene, ask the GM one yes/no question about an enemy's capabilities (free action).
Dunmer Resilience: +2 to Will against fire-based or magical fear effects; fire damage is reduced by 1 shift.

equipment.special: Signal whistle (can summon Whiterun guard reinforcements once per scene)

personality_notes.speaking_style: Terse, exact, and never wasteful with words. Gives compliments rarely - which makes them valuable. Dunmer-tinged formality in court.
motivations: Keep Balgruuf alive at any cost
Maintain Whiterun's security regardless of faction politics
Prove her worth in a city that has doubted her since arrival
Outlast every threat that comes to Whiterun
fears: Balgruuf dying because she made the wrong call
Being forced to choose between Balgruuf's orders and his survival
Whiterun's people suffering for her failures
Her race being used as a reason to dismiss her judgment
quirks: Always knows where the exits are in any room
Evaluates strangers' weapons and footwork within seconds of meeting them
Gives grudging respect when someone surprises her - and means it
Refers to Balgruuf as 'the Jarl' in public, 'Balgruuf' only in private

relationships.Jarl Balgruuf: Total loyalty; the center of her world in Whiterun
relationships.Whiterun Guard: Trains them personally; they fear and respect her
relationships.Hadvar: Respects his Imperial discipline; will work with him in the battle
relationships.Stormcloaks: No political opinion; threat assessment only
relationships.The Player: Will test them before trusting; reward her respect and she becomes an invaluable ally

trust_clock.description: Irileth's respect is earned through demonstrated competence and reliability, not words. She does not grant trust easily.
advancement_triggers: Demonstrate tactical awareness that saves Balgruuf or her guards (+2)
Hold a defensive line she assigned you (+1)
Answer her direct challenge honestly and without flinching (+1)
setback_triggers: Abandon a position under your responsibility (-2)

combat_tactics: Irileth fights close and precise. She never wastes movement. Uses her guard as a shield wall while she finds the most dangerous enemy in the room and neutralizes them. Covers retreats professionally; advances only when she's certain.
dialogue_examples: I don't care who you are or where you're from. Can you hold a line? Yes or no.
If the Jarl dies, everything we're doing here dies with him. That's not politics. That's physics.
You want to know what it's like to serve a good man in a war that might kill him? It's the hardest thing I've ever done. And I've done hard things.

battle_of_whiterun_role.imperial: Key defender in Stage 0 briefing and Stage 1 breach; grants tactical boon if PC impresses her; covers Balgruuf personally
battle_of_whiterun_role.stormcloak: Boss encounter in Dragonsreach climax (Stage 5); can be convinced to yield if Balgruuf surrenders

gm_notes: Irileth is one of the rare NPCs who will directly tell the party when they're doing something right. Her approval should feel earned. She's Dunmer in a predominantly Nord city and has survived by being twice as good as everyone else - that history should inform how she treats PCs who prove themselves. If she is killed in the Stormcloak route, run a Dragonbreak precheck.
